intro: Eupatorium urticifolium var. villicaule, commonly known as the hairy boneset, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. It thrives in moist, rich soils and is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
